issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Some test runs on May 10 and then since May 14 contain failed tasks (all 4 executions fail) but the job does not fail.  Given these dates, my suspicion is that this could be related to HADOOP-1350 or turning on speculative execution in my testing.

Some JobTracker log snippets for tip_0005_m_002705:

comments.body: Speculative execution is still turned off by default, no?  Does this occur w/o speculative execution enabled?
Actually this was a caused by a bug in HADOOP-1144 (the joys of integer-division), fixed now...
Marking this patch as ready to go - HADOOP-1411 address the other issue of the 'AlreadyBeingCreatedException' seen during the run.

+1

http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12357832/HADOOP-1407_1_20070522.patch applied and successfully tested against trunk revision r540424.

Test results:   http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/176/testReport/
Console output: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/176/console
I've just committed this.  Thanks Arun!
